The Biological Simulation Interface¶

Animals Module¶

class biosim.animals.Animals(age=None, weight=0)[source]¶

Class Animals:

animal aging: animal gain age with one every cycle

calc birth weight: animal is born with a ‘unique’ weight

weight gain: if an animal eat it gains weight

weight loss: yearly an animal lose a certain amount of weight

calc fitness: determines the overall fitness of an animal

birth: determines if a animal should give birth

migrating: probability for an animal to migrate

death: probability for an animal dying

Contains data for later use

Parameters

  • age (int) – Age of the animal

  • weight (float) – Weight of the animal

Raises

  • ValueError – Age can not be negative

  • ValueError – Weight cannot be a negative integer

animal_aging()[source]¶

Age increases with 1 for each cycle that passes

birth(n)[source]¶

An animal can mate and give birth if there is more than one animal in a cell

There is a given probability for an animal giving birth:

Calculates probability for birth

\[\begin{equation} min(1, \gamma \times \Phi \times (n-1)) \end{equation}\]

If the weight of an animal is less than a given difference, the probability is 0:

Difference

\[\begin{equation} w < \Xi \times (w_birth + \sigma_birth) \end{equation}\]

An animal can give max one offspring per year

At birth the mother lose a given weight

If this weight is more than her own weight there is no offspring

Parameters

n (int) – amount animals in one cell

Returns

Weight of newborn animal

Return type

float

calc_birth_weight()[source]¶

Calculates weight of an animal at birth

Formula for birth_weight

\[\begin{equation} w \sim GaussianDistribution \times (w_{birth}, \sigma_{birth}) \end{equation}\]
Returns

Calculated birth weight drawn from a gaussian distribution

Return type

float

calc_fitness()[source]¶

Fitness is the overall health of the animal

Fitness is zero if weight is zero, otherwise given by

Calculates fitness based on age and weight

\[\begin{equation} q^{+} (a, a_{1/2}, phi_{age}) \times q^{-} (w, w_{1/2}, phi_{weight}) \end{equation}\]

where

\[\begin{equation} q^{+-}(x, x_{1/2}, phi) = 1 / (1 + e^{{(+-)} \phi (x - x_{1/2})} \end{equation}\]
death()[source]¶

An animal die with certainty if weight = 0

And with the probability:

probability for death

\[\begin{equation} \Omega \times (1 - \Phi) \end{equation}\]
Returns

if an animal must be removed from simulation because of death

Return type

bool

migrating()[source]¶

An animal can migrate to neighbor cells with a given probability

probability for migration

\[\begin{equation} \mu \times \Phi \end{equation}\]
Returns

The probability of an animal moving from one cell to an other

Return type

bool

weight_gain(food)[source]¶

When eating, the animal gains weight

Change in weight must change the fitness

Weight gain is given by the formula

\[\begin{equation} \beta \times F \end{equation}\]
Parameters

food (float) – the amount of fodder an animal has eaten

weight_loss()[source]¶

Each cycle the animal lose weight

Given by formula:

\[\begin{equation} \eta \times w \end{equation}\]

Change in weight must change the fitness

class biosim.animals.Carnivores(age=None, weight=0)[source]¶

killing(fitness_herbivores)[source]¶

A random carnivore will kill a herbivore with the lowest fitness

Parameters

fitness_herbivores (float) – fitness of herbivore

Returns

Implements a random number to decide if a carnivore will kill a herbivore

Return type

bool

probability_kill(fitness_herbivores)[source]¶

A carnivore will kill a herbivore with a given probability

Probability for a carnivore killing a herbivore

\[\begin{equation} (\Phi_carnivore - \Phi_herbivore) / \Delta\Phi_Max \end{equation}\]
Parameters

fitness_herbivores (float) – fitness of herbivore

Returns

Calculates the probability of a carnivore killing a herbivore.

Return type

float

Cells Module¶

class biosim.cells.Cells[source]¶

Class Cells:

is mainland: if the cell is mainland the animal can move to the cell

sort the herbivore population by fitness: sort herbivore list from least fit to most fit

add animals: adds animals to a population count

animals number: counts amount of animals in the population count

annual animals weight loss and aging: update values for age and weight

migrating: sets animal into their cell

regrowth: fodder amount for the herbivores

herbivore feeding: herbivores eating the available fodder based on appetite

animal death: if animal is dead remove dead animal

carnivores eat: if herbivore is in the same cell as a herbivore it will eat herbivores to fulfill its appetite

add newborns: adds new animals to the population

kill all animals: checks if animal is alive

yearly cycle till migration: functions will happen yearly and does not rely on migration

yearly cycle after migration: yearly cycles relying on migration

contains data for later use

add_animals(population=None)[source]¶

adds the individual animals age and weight to the species population list

Parameters

population (list) – count population

annual_animals_weight_loss_and_aging()[source]¶

updates the annual weight loss and aging

carnivores_eat()[source]¶

Carnivores eat in order of highest fitness. The Carnivore tries to kill the Herbivore with lowest fitness first. The Carnivore’s weight increases.

herbivore_feeding()[source]¶

This method returns the amount of fodder available to a Herbivore. If a lot of fodder is available in the cell, enough fodder will be return to fulfill it’s appetite F. if not, whats left will be returned.

property is_mainland¶

if landscape is mainland :rtype: bool

Type

return

kill_all_animals()[source]¶

Checks if the animals are alive, if alive it is kept in the list

Is done for both herbivore and carnivore

movement_of_migrating_animals()[source]¶

An animal within a cell can move one step to its neighbor cells (but not diagonally)

It choose to do so randomly

Raises

AttributeError – Somewhere the species has been changed

Simulation Module¶

Template for BioSim class.

class biosim.simulation.BioSim(island_map, ini_pop, seed, vis_years=1, ymax_animals=None, cmax_animals=None, hist_specs=None, img_dir=None, img_base=None, img_fmt='png', img_years=None, log_file=None)[source]¶

Class for the BioSim

Parameters

  • island_map – Multi-line string specifying island geography

  • ini_pop – List of dictionaries specifying initial population

  • seed – Integer used as random number seed

  • ymax_animals – Number specifying y-axis limit for graph showing animal numbers

  • cmax_animals – Dict specifying color-code limits for animal densities

  • hist_specs – Specifications for histograms, see below

  • vis_years – years between visualization updates (if 0, disable graphics)

  • img_dir – String with path to directory for figures

  • img_base – String with beginning of file name for figures

  • img_fmt – String with file type for figures, e.g. ‘png’

  • img_years – years between visualizations saved to files (default: vis_years)

  • log_file – If given, write animal counts to this file

If ymax_animals is None, the y-axis limit should be adjusted automatically. If cmax_animals is None, sensible, fixed default values should be used. cmax_animals is a dict mapping species names to numbers, e.g.,

{‘Herbivore’: 50, ‘Carnivore’: 20}

hist_specs is a dictionary with one entry per property for which a histogram shall be shown. For each property, a dictionary providing the maximum value and the bin width must be given, e.g.,

{‘weight’: {‘max’: 80, ‘delta’: 2}, ‘fitness’: {‘max’: 1.0, ‘delta’: 0.05}}

Permitted properties are ‘weight’, ‘age’, ‘fitness’.

If img_dir is None, no figures are written to file. Filenames are formed as

f’{os.path.join(img_dir, img_base}_{img_number:05d}.{img_fmt}’

where img_number are consecutive image numbers starting from 0.

img_dir and img_base must either be both None or both strings.

add_population(population)[source]¶

setup(final_step)[source]¶

Prepare graphics.

Call this before calling update() for the first time after the final time step has changed.

Parameters

final_step – last time step to be visualised (upper limit of x-axis)

Parameters
